text: A syringe is a tool used by doctors, nurses, and healthcare professionals. It is a simple pump with a needle at the end. It allows to inject liquids into the bloodstream or the muscle. Many syringes are designed to be used only once. If a syringe is used multiple times, it needs to be serilized before each use, otherwise it is possible to spread diseases. File:Syringe2.jpg|A typical plastic medical syringe, fitted with a detachable stainless steel needle File:Spruta, Johannes Jansson (1).jpg|According to the World Health Organization, about 90% of the medical syringes are used to administer drugs, 5% for vaccinations and 5% for other uses such as blood transfusions. Swiss Telegraphic Agency, "Deux millions de personnes contaminées lors d'une injection à risque en 2014" , Radio télévision suisse, 23 February 2015 (page visited on 23 February 2015). File:Einweg-Kunststoffspritze mit Einweg- Kanüle.jpg|Typical single-use syringe, with the different parts shown. == References == Category:Medical equipment
title: Syringe
